alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 6:55AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Waupaca and northern Outagamie Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 654 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Black Creek, or 17 miles northwest of Appleton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rains, winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. Urband flooding was reported in Symco in Waupaca county. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Black Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
